remarks: If the support of the restriction of a function by a set which, subtracted from the domain of the function so that its difference is finite, the support of the function itself is finite.  (Contributed by AV, 22-Apr-2019.)
statement:
ressuppfi.b $e |- ( ph -> ( dom F \ B ) e. Fin ) $.
ressuppfi.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. W ) $.
ressuppfi.g $e |- ( ph -> G = ( F |` B ) ) $.
ressuppfi.s $e |- ( ph -> ( G supp Z ) e. Fin ) $.
ressuppfi.z $e |- ( ph -> Z e. V ) $.
ressuppfi $p |- ( ph -> ( F supp Z ) e. Fin ) $.
